messages: cf911abc05ff3ecd69eb81d2ffa2bdce (23:20): how do i ssh to serial 1?
f034cb0adf74efaf5f7b1d64207c1bed (23:20): :I
62c5a21589ab80374ab6b5d68660c084 (23:25): who have used courier-imap from pkgsrc ?
62c5a21589ab80374ab6b5d68660c084 (23:25): i have this problem with vpopmail libraries
62c5a21589ab80374ab6b5d68660c084 (23:25): http://pastebin.ca/177802
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:27): gubluntu: SSH works over IP. you'd have to setup networking over your serial line. but that's not what is usually done to just login over it...
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:28): it is already set up for only root over serial1
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:28): what?
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:28): i just dopnt know the syntax for it
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:28): networking is setup "only for root"?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:29): what you don't know is WTF you're talking about :p
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:29): all i know is that i can only get in over serial.
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (23:30): our sshd defaults to no root logins, frob the config if you want something else.  but you really should just su
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:31): jakllsch: he says he wants to login over a serial line
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:31): im ssh onto a server, another is outputting terminal to serial1 on the server im on.. how do i get at it
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (23:32): cu or tip?
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:33): how it was setup
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:34): gubluntu: cu or tip are things you could use to connect to it
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:34): like NOW
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:35): Sep 20 14:34:53 mail /netbsd: ohci0: 1 scheduling overruns
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:36): it keeps scrolling it in console
8d102cab8535e4a2d9e4ef284cd63b16 (23:36): maybe
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:36): hm.. why do i cant use: gdb --write /netbsd to set kern.rtc_offset ? is this deprecated ?
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:37): or i had to compile kernel with debug ?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:38): waKKu: I guess it's somewhat deprecated. there's a sysctl for it now. but AFAIK this should still work... what's the error message?
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:39): sphex nothing... only set no changes
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:39): waKKu: after reboot?
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:39): when i type: file /netbsd, this is loads and shows "no simbols are loaded"
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:39): sphex yeah.. after reboot too
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (23:39): gubuntu - sounds like your talking about a serial console, in which case ssh is irrelevent, cu will work, but minicom is a bit better
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (23:39): use something like:
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (23:40): assuming the baud rate of the serial console is 9600 (it usually is).
19d87ae2d3a786f0686f3f2696883592 (23:41): when you compile a kernel there should be a file with the symbols in it in the same directory.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:41): waKKu: seems to work here
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:41): cu: open (/dev/tty01): No such file or directory
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:42): there is no getty in /dev/
694e05fc4c118f2ec56b3ea7cd5651f1 (23:42): sphex show something when u typed sed kern.rtc_offset = xx ?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:42): gubluntu: getty isn't supposed to be in /dev
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:43): waKKu: shows nothing
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:43): gubluntu: what kind of computer is that?
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:45): gubluntu: ok. you'll have to find out what your serial devices are named.
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:46): maybe in tty(4)
c7973aff9b7bdb0a0ad08d5b3d1ee712 (23:47): maybe you need to MAKEDEV(8) them too...
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:48): okay.. server came back up
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:48): ill try to find that stuff out for next time
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:48): hrmm.. raid_parity?
427ed44e7187f6e30dd90cf4945391f5 (23:48): was using 40% cpu now only 10.
